summary: Personal Digital Health Management Platform

scraped_reviews.content: Solid app. Everything works and syncs up nicely. A very comprehensive fitness app! Update: I'm using the Amazfit GTS2e, and I'm noticing two problems. First, the heart rate tracker seems to stop tracking when you have a lot of wrist perspiration, and does not track at all when cycling. Second, it syncs very poorly with Google Fit. Maybe Google intentionally hinders this, to encourage purchasing a Wear OS smartwatch/band? Three years later (2025), and the app is even better than it was before.

App has changed radically since I first started using it. But still has stupid issues. Like, if I allow notifications, I get notifications all the time about keeping the band running. And if I tap the notification it doesn't clear. And if I turn off notifications then every single time I enter the app, I have to close 2 popups about allowing notifications. Seriously annoying! Also, I frequently get chided for sitting too long WHILE I AM MOVING AROUND!!! Disappointing - could be so much better!

The device (Helio ring) linked to the app is okay as a sleep tracker but would not recommend as an activity tracker. It can't seem to auto detect activities starting and the app only allows you to "start" a few simple activities - and lacks something like "cardio" as a general catch all. also requires full GPS (background all the time) even for "treadmill".

This app used to work fine. It's been a while and every single day I have to enable the notifications and do the allowances EVERY SINGLE DAY, which is really frustrating. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling buth the problem persist. Sometimes when I'm too busy and I forget to "allow" and "enable" the notifications, I miss anlot of calls and notifications because of all of that. The troubleshooters will not help at all.

This would easily be a 4- or 5-star app if it would track full sleep data 24 hours a day. Not everyone sleeps during the overnight hours and, outside of those hours, sleep is treated as a "nap," no matter how long it lasts. This means that things like stages, heart rate, breathing, etc, aren't tracked -- basically, just the length of time. Other trackers can provide data for any session that lasts a few hours or more, at any time of day.

Constant bugs. Won't connect. Switches settings by itself. Unable to force closed. Must uninstall and lose all stats to get to function properly again. Five years later: the app has been much improved. No longer having connectivity issues. Graphing of statistics could still be improved. Parameters are still way too broad, ie, pace, heart rate, altitude, to be able to see more subtle changes during a run.

Disappointed in how it [doesn't] handle naps. Even long naps are not sensed. Perhaps a workaround would be to allow a day to be defined by the user, i.e., to run from a (user set) range of say [an earliest bedtime] 21:00 to 21:00. That way, a :30 or :90 minute sleep could record as sleep, in the form of a "nap". Also, on "Walking" workouts, the elevation gain is always off. The actual high and low elevations, as marked, are accurate, with the difference between them being calculated wrong.

Decent app. Intuitive. Tons of info. Wants money for best info. That part is a letdown considering what you have to pay for the watch. If there was another app I could get that would work for the watch I would use it instead just for the insult of advertising abilities, yet not advertising the additional cost. Still a decent app for basic types of information. Sleep monitor needs much work. GPS functions are a joke. Otherwise ok. Up the price 25 bucks and give full functionality you're 4 stars

I love my Amazfit watch as it has unbelievable battery life and does everything I needed. Only issue I've had is that it doesn't always show accurate heart rate while I'm working out. Wasn't a deal breaker as it was mostly correct, however, a couple weeks ago I noticed that it no longer scores any PAI. I reported this issue twice, to include my records/logs from watch, but no response and still not working.

Once you have it set up, it works ok. However, the initial setup of the watch is quite frustrating. There are two options for connecting: WiFi or Bluetooth, or you can use a QR code. The problem is that there's no way to focus your camera, which makes the process a pain. Once it's set up, though, it functions fine. I find it scummy that the company doesn't make the app fully free even after you purchase a watch. I honestly think three stars might be generous.

It's a great app with lots of information on your body during various activities. works pretty good as a calorie counter as well. the only thing I would change is the AI that calculates photos when taking picture of food. you can take the same picture five times and get five different results. even if you say you have 100 g of chicken breast five times it could give you five different results as well. Other than that, I think it's great.

It's honestly a pretty poor app. it has a bunch of useless bells and whistles, but if you want a detailed record of distance/time, you're out of luck. Want to know your fastest quarter mile? too bad. your best time this year vs last? better start scrolling. what time you began your run? too bad. etc. etc. also, even though it's connected via Bluetooth to my watch, it's constantly saying it can't locate my position (though admittedly that could be the watch not the app).

Great app overall, and the watch itself is great. One thing though: Please add a way to keep food calories unchanged by exercise. For those who don't want to eat back calories burned. Like if my goal is 1700, I don't want exercise to "add back" the 400 hundred I burned. I want the 1700 to remain the flat total for the whole day, and for 'calories left' to only show what's left of the 1700. Not give me more for exercise.

I've had mine for a couple of months now, and I wear it at all times except for showering/bathing. So far, the watch has kept time, and the step counter seems to be reasonably close to my previous watch so far as distance calculations. I like that the watch itself can display 24 hr / military time, since that is what we use at work. The battery life is very good. I've been getting over 7 days use on a full charge.

Honestly one of the best watches and apps I have had. Definitely something to try before getting Apple, Samsung, or Google. I really enjoy all the features. There is a subscription but you don't have to pay for it unless you want more in-depth information on your sleep. They have a deal going on for $39.99 for the whole year which is great or 59.99 for plus. Which is amazing especially depending on how much you paid for the watch. Mine was 79.99 so with my subscription it was a little over $100

Kinda wish there was a setting to add when you expect to sleep and when you are awake. Night shift makes my sleep score look poor simply because only have a 6-8 hour nap. Also would like to be able to change the gui layout of my watch. since and update around the beginning of the year, text notifications aren't coming through. calls sometimes don't and when they do the info is not available even though they are in my contacts. permissions have been troubleshot.

just got this watch and trying out the app. don't care for the persistent reminder on my phone to keep the zepp app running. also on calendar reminders, the watch keeps buzzing and showing a reminder until i acknowledge it. if i tap remind me later, it reminds me 10 minutes later. too soon and really not necessary. food logging is poor, with wildly incorrect calorie counts.

Holy Battery Drainer! I couldn't figure out why my battery was draining while my phone was charging, until I turned off the Zepp app that was running in the background. App consistently disconnects from watch. On top of that, the app is not user-friendly at all, sleep tracker is basic af, the GPS sucks. I could think of 15 ways to seriously improve this app right off the top of my head. I'll be opting for a FitBit or Garmin instead.

Meh. Lots of improvements could be made. Goals are not flexible enough for people like me who are somewhat disabled and older. There's no ability to toggle on/off which notifications I want -- they're either all on or all off. It's truly not the most intuitive or easy to use UI. I like my fitness band, but am not particularly happy with the app.

The formula for calculating calories is so far beyond utterly broken that it's completely worthless. Today I've done 3400 steps and apparently burned a whopping 800kcal. It does this every day. It didn't work out that I was doing a workout by itself so the next time I manually set it to a weight workout for 50 mins. Not a super intense one. 600kcal!? This means food/calorie tracking is impossible in Zepp. I export data elsewhere.

Because this watch is touch screen, when you're sweaty after a run, you cant stop it. And its glitchy. It doesnt connect to the GPS 85% of the time, therefore, it doesnt track your run right. although, it Measures steps, heart rate, blood oxygen, stress, your sleep, mileage, calories, and tons more.

The app will occasionally freeze up my phone such that I cannot get to the home screen, launch another app, or even switch to an app that is already running. I can swipe down from the top, but the only option that works there is the one for power. So I reboot the phone and it works fine for a couple days until it happens again. I haven't experienced anything like it with any other app.

Would be 4 stars but since the new update, I am not able to change my background. It says "start syncing" but doesn't, then the app freezes and won't let me back out. I've uninstall it several times and I've restarted my phone many times and nothing works. If this doesn't get fixed, I won't buy another amazfit watch and I'll get a galaxy watch instead, I heard those don't have any issues with their app.

it'd be great if my settings didn't change by themselves and the actual lock would work when I set it so it doesn't wake me up multiple times shining in my face ANNOYING It is Very Informative. Sometimes I don't believe it is tracking my steps appropriately. But the data it tracks is truly amazing. Just subscribed for a year so will update in awhile 10/30 Also. The wrist band stretches upon consistent wear and I have 2 notches left before its at the shortest setting. Not sure what I'll do then

Watch out Fitbit! Data seems more complete that what is provided on Fitbit. After using exclusively Fitbit for years I decided to start using Zepp and an Amazfit 7 Band. It's taken a while to get used to, but wow! The only weakness this app has is food tracking. The barcode scanner rarely finds items. The photo AI thing is cool and works well, but I prefer to have more control over all the nutritional information without having to edit database numbers.

I use my watch for keeping track of location during hikes. Update: they did add the trimming feature like Garmin has. Now my only complaint is all the upselling texts they send. Almost daily! So annoying! It's easy to personalize to see the stats I want and hide others. They recently added a way to trim the record so it doesn't show my drive home before I realized it was still running. The app data report still massively overestimates total elevation. Love being able edit workout titles.

wow here we are Sept 2025 and this product and company are gettin worse. don't bother 11/24 update sucks. The app iterface is so discombobulated that it is almost worthless. Not to mention that it is now failing to record workouts. Not work spending your money, since they don't bother caring about custer input. As of late the app is requiring notifications. However if I turn them on I get nonsense notices about keep running. When I am not . Then the app crashes almost every day during my walk.

Wildly inaccurate info, espec. with sleep functions, heart rate. It records me being asleep, when awake and moving around, vice vera. If it cannot accurately record sleep, all other related functions are also incorrect. Heart rate monitor also inaccurate. Wore this along with a medical grade heart rate monitor, as I was so worried by the Zepp results. The price is nice. Simple user with simple needs. but it doesn't deliver on basic essentials. Respectfully.

The Zepp app tracks all the desired health information you typically want to see. It takes a little while getting used to the way data is displayed. One area of improvement for the app would be to display the totals for tracked data. For example, the app provides the average steps taken for a week and month but does not display the total steps taken for the week, month, or year. That would be a helpful feature.

Pretty smooth and helpful. There are some glitches in setup, display, and notifications, and the software might benefit from a native English speaking athlete or two on the development team, but still a good utility. I'm lately frustrated that the screen lock during exercises still allows a stray touch to pause the workout, so a stray drop of sweat might negate half your workout...

This app links to my Amazfit watch. I find the map of where I have walked to be very accurate and quite detailed. It allows me to set goals for exercise which it monitors and gives gentle reminders to keep on track. A good app. It has premium options which look good but I haven't subscribed them to yet. This is a great app!

This app is great when it actually works. One of the main reasons I got this watch was to have notifications from my phone while I work, so I know if it's important enough to warrant taking my phone out. The problem is that it keeps dropping notification permissions! This happens so often, and it's getting annoying! At least once or more every week, I have to go into the app and reactivate notification permissions. That's something I should only have to do ONE TIME and never again! Fix this!!!!!

Mixed feelings about this app. Works well enough but it's constantly trying to upsell premium content that I don't care about and I don't see a way to opt out. The exertion metric seems random. A two hour walk of 6+ mile isn't much exertion? The store for watch faces is painful to use - there's no way to sort or filter them. But there's plenty of data in the app and it's fairly straightforward to use / learn.

algorithms have seious flaws For example, when swimming it won't count kickboard laps. This is a common part of swimming workouts but the amazfit watch interprets it as standing still, I'm guessing because there's no rhythmic arm movement. I have GPS turned on, so don't you think the watch should "know" when I've moved from one end of the pool to the other? I would just fudge it by calling it walking or something, but then I'd run the risk of water damage. Please fix.

The app itself is ok though not always easy to navigate and find what you want. The data that is collected by the watch is frequently inaccurate for heart rate and sleep. As for the app, it will not let you adjust the sleep data after a certain time, even if it is entirely wrong (it often believes I am asleep if I am reading and relaxing). Nap data cannot be altered, and reports of data issues do not seem to acknowledged. If you want accuracy this app (and watch) may not be for you.

I'm still learning how to use it, but the more I learn, the more I like it. Battery life blows my mind.. 2 weeks at least on a single charge.. also it charges from 0 to full in less than an hour. I would choose this watch over my fit bit every single time.. never any connection issues or having to reconnect it constantly.. I'm super happy with this purchase.. now if only I could figure out how to play music on it. ü§îüôÉ

I used to love this brand. But the latest device and software are almost unusable now. Accidentally starts recording things. Too many new "features" that are not needed. Enters into settings mode randomly all the time (because they decided to make a long press on the main screen as an ingress). Overall despite the price being so much less, it may be time to consider paying for a Fitbit or Garmin.

The watch is awesome! The battery lasts a few days. A friend got it for me to monitor my sleep. I really is crazy accurate! I wear to run. It gives so much information during your running. It tracks the exact route better than Google maps, your speed, distance, heart rate, average speed, calories burned. It tells you when you've reached each mile and your speed and heart rate at each mile. I gave it 4 stars because if you have the watch in work out mode you can't switch songs.

I purchased an amazfit 5 watch ( less than a month ago) which is now useless, because I can't get it to unlink from a phone that got damaged, or log into the app, or use the aura subscription I'm paying for. I can't log into anything. I've called several times tried every option. there is absolutely no way to get anyone on the phone. I left a message twice no call back. So basically I buy your product, you refuse to provide any support and I'm out the 50 something for the watch ok great ty.

Does not always report accurate heart rate during workouts and as of 4 days ago it is no longer keeping history of workouts. Sometime after my first review records retention went back to as it had been. I can't think of anything else that I would want to be different. Edit: app stability has continued to improve, I'm not sure how they could make it better.

The app is decent and has many watch faces to download. The watch faces could be better organized with a sort feature. The connection between the watch and phone is poor. I used to have to reconnect it once a month, then that turned into once a week, and starting about 2 weeks ago, it is every day, sometimes multiple times a day. I have put in numerous help tickets since it started last year, and all they send me is a long list of things to try and when that doesn't work, they blame my phone.

I love my new Amazafit watch & Zepp app. I've had it for a few months now. This watch is a great price for anyone on a budget. It works pretty good, I would say just as good or even better than high name brands that are much more expensive. I am very impressed with the capabilities this thing has. It tracks my sleep schedule & patterns, my daily steps, etc. They want you to pay for extra things like sleep details & a few others, but it's not required.

I refuse to buy any watch faces through their store until they figure out a way to show if a face has an AOD (always on display) option. I'm tired of buying half complete watch faces because I can't tell if it has an AOD version. And you can't get them refunded because Google doesn't allow refunds for in-app purchases. Absolutely wild that this isn't already part of the app.

I'm using this app with a Band 7 and it's just OK. I notice that when I use the app and my arms don't swing (mowing the lawn) this doesn't pick up steps and probably doesn't really generate how far I walked via the GPS. I use the device and the app just to keep track of any activity I do, I don't think I would count on either if I was looking for very accurate data.

Not very accurate. It records me as napping when I take my watch off to shower, and lately it doesn't record my sleep at all, but when I wake up it records me as napping. I haven't received notifications of calls or texts in a long time. It just keeps getting worse and worse. At this point it's just an expensive watch to tell me what time it is.

I didn't even know this was included with my watch when I bought it, so that was a nice bonus. I find this app very good. There is lots of tracking info, and I can set up pretty detailed custom training templates. Decent food tracking. There are lots of useful apps for my watch. I wish the Zepp Coach was a bit more customizable as it seems pretty basic at the moment.

it has some good features but it also has some bugs period for example it will not change your allowed calorie. For example I have mine set to 1500 Cal but it keeps it at 2,000 and then when I exercise it adds more calories allowed based on the calories burned. To track the calories you've eaten you have to record all your meals and add them up individually.

Recent zepp app updates added so many types of trackers, food calorie counter/journal and features. Before bed and wake up journal.. and so many more useful options. I spent almost an hour reviewing everything in detail. Great app. the Amazfit watch I've had for over a year. Everything works great!!! The most budget friendly investment I ever made for my health. Ya really get to know yourself better on another level.

The app+watch works well, is easy to use and overall is a great addition to managing my lifestyle. I like the activity tracker detail, the exertion/recovery monitor and suggestions. The PAI metric matches well with my perceived exertion level. However I can't get good tracking if I'm doing non-listed activity where my arms are not swinging eg. mowing the lawn. (I'm open to workaround suggestions.)

This app/watch rarely adds sleep time to the initial sleep time if I get up, but don't go back to bed for 45 min to an hour later due to coughing or can't stay asleep. So my sleep score isn't calculated for the whole sleep time. Otherwise, I think it is fairly accurate. I especially like the heart, stress, and oxygen monitoring and the weather forecast.I REALLY wish for blood pressure monitoring and body temperature measurement. I don't use workout part. I highly recommend the watch and app!!

title: AlfredCamera Home Security app
description:
We are the world‚Äôs most popular and top-rated security camera app for Android phones, with over 70 million families around the world choosing AlfredCamera to turn their old phones into powerful home security cameras, baby monitors, pet cams, and more.

AlfredCamera is an all-in-one home security camera app providing more features than a expensive CCTV security camera system. It's live cam with instant intruder alert is perfect as a security camera, baby monitor, nanny cam, pet monitor, dog monitor, and more.

AlfredCamera is well-recognized as:
‚è© ‚ÄúMost Innovative App‚Äù Ôºç Google Play (2016)
‚è© ‚ÄúMost Popular Utility App‚Äù Ôºç Google Play (2019)
‚è© ‚ÄúOne of the Best App Options for Setting up Your Phone as a Security Camera‚Äù Ôºç CNET (Feb 2023)
‚è© ‚ÄúHome Protection is Achieved at Low Cost and Without Many Complications‚Äù Ôºç Infobae (June 2021)

FEATURES
Whether you‚Äôre looking for a surveillance camera app or webcam app to keep an eye on your belongings, a baby camera app to look after your newborn, a pet cam app or dog camera app to entertain your lovely pets, the AlfredCamera home security camera app is the perfect solution for your smart home.

‚úÖ 24/7 LIVE STREAM: Watch high-quality live video from anywhere with Alfred's live camera stream. 
‚úÖ SMART INTRUDER ALERT:  Get instant alerts when movement is detected
‚úÖ LOW-LIGHT FILTER: Enhanced visibility at night for your nanny cam, pet monitor.
‚úÖ WALKIE-TALKIE: Deter thieves, interact with visitors or pets, and soothe babies.
‚úÖ 360 CAMERA: Cover a larger area with both lenses.
‚úÖ ZOOM, SCHEDULE, SOUND DETECTION, REMINDER, TRUST CIRCLE, SIREN, and more...
Works smoothly via WiFi, 3G, and LTE.

SUPER EASY TO SET UP
AlfredCamera is the easiest-to-install surveillance camera system with professional-grade features that allows you to DIY your own home security camera, pet cam, baby cam or nanny cam in few minutes:

üîπ Install Alfred Camera App on two devices, your old phone becomes the camera, your current device is the viewer
üîπ Scan a QR code to pair them.
üîπ Cross-platform support: Android and iOS devices work together effortlessly

ANYTIME, ANYWHERE
Unlike traditional CCTV cameras or home surveillance cameras, Alfred is a portable CCTV camera, place it anywhere for extra security. It works great as a nanny cam, baby camera, or dog monitor while traveling, renting an Airbnb, or simply checking in during work hours.

üì∑ SIMPLE SECURITY AT YOUR FINGERTIPS

descriptionHTML:
We are the world‚Äôs most popular and top-rated security camera app for Android phones, with over 70 million families around the world choosing AlfredCamera to turn their old phones into powerful home security cameras, baby monitors, pet cams, and more.

AlfredCamera is an all-in-one home security camera app providing more features than a expensive CCTV security camera system. It's live cam with instant intruder alert is perfect as a security camera, baby monitor, nanny cam, pet monitor, dog monitor, and more.

AlfredCamera is well-recognized as:
‚è© ‚ÄúMost Innovative App‚Äù Ôºç Google Play (2016)
‚è© ‚ÄúMost Popular Utility App‚Äù Ôºç Google Play (2019)
‚è© ‚ÄúOne of the Best App Options for Setting up Your Phone as a Security Camera‚Äù Ôºç CNET (Feb 2023)
‚è© ‚ÄúHome Protection is Achieved at Low Cost and Without Many Complications‚Äù Ôºç Infobae (June 2021)

FEATURES
Whether you‚Äôre looking for a surveillance camera app or webcam app to keep an eye on your belongings, a baby camera app to look after your newborn, a pet cam app or dog camera app to entertain your lovely pets, the AlfredCamera home security camera app is the perfect solution for your smart home.

‚úÖ 24/7 LIVE STREAM: Watch high-quality live video from anywhere with Alfred's live camera stream.
‚úÖ SMART INTRUDER ALERT: Get instant alerts when movement is detected
‚úÖ LOW-LIGHT FILTER: Enhanced visibility at night for your nanny cam, pet monitor.
‚úÖ WALKIE-TALKIE: Deter thieves, interact with visitors or pets, and soothe babies.
‚úÖ 360 CAMERA: Cover a larger area with both lenses.
‚úÖ ZOOM, SCHEDULE, SOUND DETECTION, REMINDER, TRUST CIRCLE, SIREN, and more...
Works smoothly via WiFi, 3G, and LTE.

SUPER EASY TO SET UP
AlfredCamera is the easiest-to-install surveillance camera system with professional-grade features that allows you to DIY your own home security camera, pet cam, baby cam or nanny cam in few minutes:

üîπ Install Alfred Camera App on two devices, your old phone becomes the camera, your current device is the viewer
üîπ Scan a QR code to pair them.
üîπ Cross-platform support: Android and iOS devices work together effortlessly

ANYTIME, ANYWHERE
Unlike traditional CCTV cameras or home surveillance cameras, Alfred is a portable CCTV camera, place it anywhere for extra security. It works great as a nanny cam, baby camera, or dog monitor while traveling, renting an Airbnb, or simply checking in during work hours.

üì∑ SIMPLE SECURITY AT YOUR FINGERTIPS
With a crystal clear live camera stream, instant alerts and events recorded, Alfred will help you to always know what‚Äôs happening and keep evidences in any incident.

‚úîÔ∏è Monitor pets when you're away with a reliable dog camera or pet cam

‚úîÔ∏è Protect your home with smart motion-triggered alerts
‚úîÔ∏è Create a smart CCTV system, your own pet cam, baby camera, or dog camera using just two phones and the Alfred app.

SMART, CONVENIENT, ECO-CONSCIOUS
First time choosing a CCTV camera app or home security system? The best home surveillance camera app you can ever find: reliable, versatile, and easy to use. scraped_reviews.content: Used to be reasonably priced. The price has gone up considerably. I was a paid user last year but the app is constantly having issues with the phones, losing connection for various reasons even though it's supposed to be set to "always on top." Too unreliable to be "security." The free plan is worthless. You can "see" the feed, but not access any recordings, so unless you're able to do nothing but stare at your phone all day watching the feed, it's not going to show you anything.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for reaching out. Could you kindly try the troubleshooting suggestions in the following link to see if that helps: https://url.alfredcamera.app/page/8EA8 Otherwise, you could also contact us via the in-app 'Contact Us' channel to share more details. Any relevant screenshots would be helpful too!

scraped_reviews.content: Even though I had never tried an app like this before, I was still skeptical. But I have to say, it has more than met my expectations. Works REALLY great!! 10/12/25: I haven't been using the app for a little over a year due to no wifi for 2nd phone, but I have WiFi now & I needed to use the app again. When I got the 2 phones running the app, I quickly discovered that you can't do anything useful with the app anymore, like recording in any way without buying a subscription. Useless now
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your valuable feedback. At AlfredCamera, we continuously strive to enhance our services to better meet your needs. Rest assured that we will relay your feedback to the relevant departments. If you have any other feedback or suggestions, please don't hesitate to contact us through the in-app "Contact Us" channel.

scraped_reviews.content: Alfred has saved me so much money on security cameras to monitor my home and office while I'm away. You can use any old device with a camera to set up and either watch live or turn on the motion detection to get notifications when it detects movement. It really is a great app! I've been using it for over 7 years now. At first, I was using the free version. But after being a loyal customer for so long I decided to upgrade to the paid monthly subscription. Totally worth it! Thank, Alfred!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We sincerely appreciate your use of our app and are thrilled that you're enjoying our services. If you encounter any usage-related issues, please feel free to contact us through the in-app channel or via email (support@alfred.camera).

scraped_reviews.content: You will permanently lose your subscription after you log out the first time. There is no way to contact support in the app. Attempting to sign up for premium again just tells you that you're already subscribed. the only tech support advice is to log out and log back in. I have 3 different phones with this app, and none of them can access my premium account. The free version does pop ups every 30s so you can barely use it at all.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We'd love to figure things out for you. Since we do not have access to your information here, would you mind using the in-app "Contact Us" channel to share more details? Any relevant screenshots would be helpful too!

scraped_reviews.content: This is the worst security app I've encountered. It is full of glitches, first, if you turn the watermark off, it doesn't save and toggles back on when you turn your camera back on again. Second, continues recording is also broken as it doesn't always work. Third, the events recorded sometimes save sideways contrary to the cameras original position. Fourth and last, you can't view events when you switch to viewer on the primary device when switching from camera mode.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We're sorry to hear that Alfred didn't match your expectation. We'd love to figure things out for you. Since we cannot access your information here, if there is anything specific we can look into, please use the in-app "Contact Us" channel to share more details.

scraped_reviews.content: it is simple to install, and set up. Many different settings to set up your device with, although quite a few of them are Upgraded to pro settings. That is fine with me for now. The app is easy to understand and navigate, so any body could be using their old devices to secure their whatever wherever. . oh yeah it is free well the version I am using for now.Just need good WiFi and a power source , and you're in business.

scraped_reviews.content: I've had Alfred for a while now. I started when they had no cameras to sell. Just use your phone. Over time, this app has become less and less worth using. I have multi-gig wi-fi with complete coverage of my home. Connection to the device is good, but doing playback now is a complete time waste. It's always freezing, and I have to close the app and go back in. The motion detection has decreased in reliability over time. Now, I can't even buy cameras because they are out. Time for a change!!

scraped_reviews.content: I've used Alfred for many years. Little by little, with the free version, things are taken away. An example is that I was able to playback short video instances . I have used this app for YEARS. I kept using it every time they added more and more ads to the Basic membership... (I know they've got bills to pay!) But now I'm expected to upgrade just to replay my events? I DON'T THINK SO. I was perfectly happy with the Basic membership until now. scraped_reviews.content: I like it, however, it does disconnect quite often. I recently thought I'd sample an upgrade, thinking that might be better, but no, it still disconnects. Worked great for years. Didn't mind the ads, I know they needs to make money. Recently we set it all up to watch our cats while we were gone for a couple days and was pretty surprised to see I can't watch events (yes, Alfred, I know you can download each event one at a time, but it's still just purposefully frustrating the user to force us to go to your subscription. Well I'm tired of everyone wanting infinite money. If you wanted a one time fee I'd pay it) Going to find an alternative.

scraped_reviews.content: Alfred was a five star app for me and I loved it. However, features such as Playback and Events have recently been removed from the standard functionality and instead have been replaced with an annual/monthly subscription service. Either way, it's pretty disappointing and drastically changes how useful the app is for users that don't wish to subscribe to yet another service. I'd much rather a one time payment.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Corey, thanks for reaching out! You can upgrade to Alfred Plus, which is a one-time payment that removes all ads. Please tap on "remove ads" below a pop-up ad to go to the payment page. Hope this helps!

scraped_reviews.content: Do not upgrade! I enjoyed the basic version for many years, and I had no advertisement notifications. I emailed them and they said they didn't know how to turn those off and would try to work on it. This is ridiculous.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We'd love to figure things out for you. Since we do not have access to your information here, would you mind contacting us again? Any relevant screenshots would be helpful too!

scraped_reviews.content: 4 stars, except ... The app itself is good and works as described and is well thought out and layed out. However, I deducted 1 star due to the fact that this app requires the phone to be left plugged in and will destroy the battery on any older phones that do not have smart charging, which at this time is all older phones. We have now destroyed the batteries on 3 phones; an S4, an S5 and an LG L9. Because of this and for outdoor use, we will be getting IP cameras instead. I love the app and idea. It may be better in another year or two when phones with smart charging are being upgraded and discarded cheap. *Note to developers: If this app could be easily connected to IP cameras as well as phones it could really be a 5 star app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:

For the feature you mentioned, we will look into the possibility in the future. Wish you the best!

scraped_reviews.content: I've recommended this app to several friends for years. We've been using it to monitor our newborn in the evenings. Ads/disconnects are annoying but we put up with them since this was a great tool on a tight budget. Going to bed tonight I can't access the live stream for more than 5 minutes or playback videos I get notifications for without "pay us" pop ups. There was ZERO warning this was going to happen so we've had to scramble for another solution and do not recommend this at all anymore.

scraped_reviews.content: Almost unbelievable with how well this works. Easy to set up and navigate through the interface. One of my must-download apps when I get a new phone. Never know when you might need it... 08-01-22 Just keeps getting better. As long as you're signed in on the phone/phones you want to use and everything is up to date, you can leave your home without having Alfred on and it'll still instantly turn it on and bring your camera up. This is a very convenient app to have.

Doesn't capture full events. Has a tendency to crash a lot. Not useful if you aren't present to restart the device. This is on a brand new galaxy tablet with all settings set according to troubleshoot and strong uninterrupted internet connection. If you are depending on this to monitor the care of a family member or watch your home while out, it is not reliable enough. Better for a nursery camera where you are able to go in and fix the camera. This review is for full (paid) version.

scraped_reviews.content: One of the most useful app. Peace of mind is the first thing you have. The only issue is the fact that even the standart version of the app can not be downloaded in certain countries. Downgraded to 1 star. Crashing all the time. scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback. You get this error when Google regards your account's activity as invalid and requires you to sign in again. Here's how you can improve the issue

1. Remove Alfred's access from Google and sign in again:https://myaccount.google.com/permissions
2. Use a stronger password if the issue persists.

Hope this helps!

scraped_reviews.content: Great app ! And unless you want the premium services, it's totally free, no cost for the app, no cost for the cameras because you already own them ! You can't beat that for a basic video surveillance system ! Another plus is that with most basic systems, you are limited by the length of the video cable, these are only limited by how good your WiFi signal is !

scraped_reviews.content: Great for a quick, basic pet cam. Setup was SURPRISINGLY quick, simple, and easy. Set up an account on one phone, log in on the other, set one as camera and one as viewer. Bought a gooseneck phone holder and can monitor my puppy's behavior when I leave. Haven't used any of the other features, like motion detection. Turned on/off flashlight on camera phone. Voice/speak didn't work but I probably need to mess with it. Ads don't diminish functionality. Will buy if we will use after puppyhood.

Most things this great you pay for and this is free! You can pay to have to zoom in feature or a few others which I do pay for and do like but at least you're not forced to pay and it works better than most sirens I've tried and everyone had old phones laying around and those are your cameras if you have wifi! Pretty rad. Should have left this review years ago. Sorry I didn't but I've been using it for years and it's nice if you move a lot. Not tons of drama setting up each time.

EDIT: Solid app,reliable to say the least. Does what it says very well. For those concerned with intrusive or overwhelming ad after ad, you've got nothing to be connected with here. Obviously they've got to pay the bills but either their sponsors pay extremely well or Alfred simply has more considerate devs than just about any other app on the play store. I removed my previous remarks but would say that if you have more time before requesting a rating, you'd see a million more 5* no doubt!

This is a difficult company to get a hold of.  I elected to upgrade my account via PayPal for $29.99.  The funds were taken out of my account but no upgrade. scraped_reviews.content: Honeslty??? I cannot recommend this enough! I have a few older phones (less then 5 years old so decent hardware and cameras) and I came across this app on a PC Mag article. Plus the paid version is not that much and comes with a bunch of QOL features!

This is my updated review for the newer version. Hands down, the way to go if you need a security camera, baby monitor, or keep an eye on the pet(s).I purchased the premium version and the added features are worth it. You might not use the features like zoom on a regular basis but having those extra tools at your disposal when you might really need them (zoom in on a suspicious individual snooping around your property for id purposes). No monthly charges, pretty much maintenance free.I recommend.

It is free with advertising. Advertising is not annoying. It pops up after the viewing activity is captured on the monitoring device. Other missing features.....can't freeze the frame or zoom in, only available with an upgrade. I might be willing to upgrade to a paid subscription. However, they're asking for credit card information without showing the cost.

I set up alfred at home before leaving on an extended trip. It worked correctly for a little over a week, during which i was able to see a live feed, and review motion capture events. scraped_reviews.content: Just awesome. Turned my old phone into a home security camera. Setup took a little back & forth, you just have to pair in correct order for the right device to be designated as the camera & the other as the viewer, but they also make it pretty easy to switch. Motion recording is accurate & alerts are on time, recording is specific not excessively long. Auto low-light mode turns on when the sun goes down. Can't say enough good things about it worth every penny for the subscription.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! We're glad to know that features like Motion Detection and auto Low-light mode are meeting your expectations. If you have any questions or need assistance, don't hesitate to contact us in-app. Your support means a lot!

scraped_reviews.content: I am in total agreement with Richard M, who makes the review below mine. I have used the free version for over a month with various types of phones and tablets and always have connection problems with the 3 cams I have in use now. No problems with the signal with other electronics on our WiFi, just Alfred, so I have to believe its a problem with this app as it seems to be too particular about the WiFi signal. Its a great idea for use of old phones etc, but not dependable. At best this might work as a backup or addition to a real security cam system, but I need 100% coverage and I cant justify spending money on something as unreliable as this. I will continue to use for now, and hope that they get problems worked out, and if they do I may purchase the full app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,¬†

Thanks for reaching out¬†to Alfred!

For connectivity problem, please follow the instructions here to see if the issue can be improved:¬†
https://alfred.camera/forum/t/1073315

You are also welcome to write us an issue report via "Contact Us" (on Viewer's menu list). We will give you more specific advice accordingly!

scraped_reviews.content: This app is being fairly unreliable, and I'm not sure what the issue is. Half of the time it records things and alerts me, which is great because we rely on it for post deliveries. But the other half of the time, it fails to record or notify entirely. Some trucks go by but it fails to capture, and yesterday someone was standing still looking around with no prior entry footage. Hope this all gets fixed or I'll be forced to switch services. And yes, my settings for recording are in fact correct
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Here are some troubleshooting steps to help you with these recording issues: https://alfredcamera.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360040156191 If the issue persists, please contact us via the in-app "Report an issue" channel and we'd love to take a further look for you.

scraped_reviews.content: Really straight forward and easy to set up and use. It has the ability to switch between front and back cameras, turn on the flashlight, a night vision mode that works surprisingly well and even blast a siren if you see an intruder. Not to mention a talkback button if you're using it as a baby monitor or front door surveillance. It has everything anyone could need for a good security camera system. The only downside is very low resolution and restricted record duration for the free version.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We‚Äôre always working on improving our service. Feel free to let us know how we can make Alfred better for you anytime.

scraped_reviews.content: I bought the annual subscription. In the beginning, it seemed as if I received the motion detection notifications to my phone consistently. However lately, it seems as if I don't receive the notifications when applicable. While it has been recording the motions detected (I also have the notifications setting turned on, as always), I simply don't receive the texts consistently. It is for this reason that I recommend not relying solely on Alfred, but also having another security system in place.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, thank you for reaching out to Alfred!

Regarding the issue, please try some troubleshooting steps here to see if the issue can be improved: https://alfred.camera/forum/t/23419 

Hope it helps!

scraped_reviews.content: Let me sett the record straight. 1. No, you don't need to leave your phone unlocked. Ensure your phone's settings aren't interfering if you're having trouble with this. 2. Memory issues are your fault, not the app's. 3. If you use low end devices for your cameras, expect low end results. Alfred App is the best, and I've been using it near two years without a single issue.

Exceptional for a free app! Flawlessly works between my pixel (viewer) and fire hd (recorder) for when I have to leave for a few days and need to keep an eye on my pets. It even has motion detection within free app! One thing I would like to have is a one time "buying" option to support the author. I use it maybe twice a year for a few days so a subscription does not really make sense (also I don't really need any new features), but I would be glad to pay like 5$ just to say "thank you".

Been wanting a security system for awhile, but costs too much. Love that I can just use old phones laying around that have no use anymore. Will probably upgrade soon, but want to continue trying it out. Only complaint I have is I wish more than one user could view cameras at once. If that's a even complaint. Nice for privacy though. Otherwise, set up was super easy and only took a few minutes. Very impressed that this is free!

Used to be a great app supported by ads. Now you can't see anything but live view; all events are under a pay wall which is more expensive than most. On top of that, the events are saved to YOUR DEVICE instead of the cloud. I will just use an inexpensive, different brand camera (of which I have others, so no additional app) with an SD card, which has no monthly fee, and delete this now worthless app, which constantly goes offline anyway.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for reaching out. As a Free user, you can access Activity Detection videos by downloading the Event, continuing to use AlfredCamera without a subscription, and benefiting from key features. Your understanding is highly appreciated. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us through the in-app "Contact Us" channel.

scraped_reviews.content: I've loved this app for more than a year, but it might as well just make it paid-only at this point. Progressively more annoying ads, and now you can't access playback or recorded events remotely as a free user. Defeats the purpose of the app. I get that they want to make money, but there are free apps out there that do what I need. Will be switching.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your valuable feedback. At AlfredCamera, we continuously strive to enhance our services to better meet your needs. Rest assured that we will relay your feedback to the relevant departments. If you have any other suggestions, please don't hesitate to contact us through the in-app "Contact Us" channel.

scraped_reviews.content: Opens a random installed browser when I exit the only camera. Add spam. Developer reply, I understand the need for adds. I have no problem with adds. The amount, use and placement of adds for this application is excessive. It makes no sense to me to spend over 15 dollars to remove these adds with the extremely limited connectivity of this app. I would be fine with the normal 1 or so dollars to remove adds. I would also likely pay for a monthly plus service if there where more features.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, thanks for the feedback.

You can try Alfred Premium, which offers ad removals, HD viewing/recording, Zoom and more! Find out more here: https://alfredcamera.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360030851051

Hope this helps!

scraped_reviews.content: The free version detects motion and records events. Since it's free, I really can't complain too much. But they've recently ramped up the ads significantly, and you can no longer view videos on the app. You now must download them one at a time (no bulk download for free users). This latter change reduces its utility significantly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for updating the review. At AlfredCamera, we continuously strive to enhance our services to better meet your needs. Rest assured that we will relay your feedback to the relevant departments. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us through the in-app "Contact Us" channel.

scraped_reviews.content: a quite amazing piece of software/app! it was setup and running in less than 10 minutes!! quite a few extras that you only find on an expensive setup... but this is FREE!!! if you're looking for a great home security setup and ya got a couple of old smartphones laying around, put em to use: download the app on your phones, go thru the setup instructions, place the cam where you want it and then sit back, enjoy the show... whether you're across the street or across the country...

title: Windy.com - Weather Forecast
description:
Windy.com is an extraordinary tool for weather forecast visualization. It‚Äôs fast, intuitive, detailed and most accurate weather app trusted by professional pilots, paragliders, skydivers, kiters, surfers, boaters, fishermen, storm chasers and weather geeks, and even by governments, army staffs and rescue teams. Whether you are tracking a tropical storm or potential severe weather, planning a trip, pursuing your favourite outdoor sport, or you just need to know if it will rain this weekend, Windy provides you with the most up-to-date weather forecast around. The uniqueness of Windy lies in the fact that it brings you better quality information than the other weather apps‚Äô pro-features, while our product is absolutely free and even without ads. Powerful, smooth and fluid presentation makes weather forecasting a real pleasure!

All forecast models at once

Windy brings you all the world‚Äôs leading weather forecasting models: global ECMWF, GFS and ICON plus local NEMS, AROME, UKV, ICON EU and ICON-D2 (for Europe). Furthermore NAM and HRRR (for the USA) and ACCESS (for Australia).

51 weather maps

From wind, rain, temperature and pressure to swell or CAPE index, with Windy you will have all convenient weather maps just at your fingertips.

Satellite & Doppler radar

Global satellite composite is created from NOAA, EUMETSAT, and Himawari. The image frequency is 5-15 minutes based on area. Doppler radar covers large parts of Europe, America, Asia, and Australia.

Point of interests

Windy lets you display observed wind and temperature, forecasted weather, airports around the World, collection of 55 000 weather webcams and 1500+ paragliding spots right on the map.

Fully customizable

Add your favorite weather maps to quick menu, customize color palette on any layer, access advanced options in the settings. All that makes Windy the weather geek‚Äôs tool of choice.

Features and data sources

‚úÖ All leading weather forecast models: ECMWF, GFS by NOAA, ICON and more ‚úÖ Several local weather models NEMS, ICON EU and ICON-D2, AROME, NAM, HRRR, ACCESS ‚úÖ High-Res satellite composite ‚úÖ Forecast model comparison ‚úÖ 51 global weather maps ‚úÖ Weather radar for many world locations ‚úÖ 16 altitude levels from the surface to 13.5km/FL450 ‚úÖ Metric or imperial units ‚úÖ Detailed weather forecast for any location (temperature, rain and snow accumulation, wind speed, wind gusts and wind direction) ‚úÖ Detailed Airgram and Meteogram ‚úÖ Meteogram: temperature and dew point, wind speed and wind gusts, pressure, precipitation, altitude cloud cover ‚úÖ Altitude and Time zone info, Sunrise and Sunset time for any location ‚úÖ Customizable list of Favorite spots (with the option to create mobile or e-mail alerts for upcoming weather conditions) ‚úÖ Nearby weather stations (Real-time observed weather - Reported wind direction, wind speed and temperature) ‚úÖ 50k+ Airports searchable by ICAO and IATA, including runway info, decoded & raw METARs, TAF and NOTAMs ‚úÖ 1500+ Paragliding spots ‚úÖ Detailed wind and wave forecast for any kiting or surfing spot ‚úÖ 55K Weather webcams ‚úÖ Tide forecast ‚úÖ Topographic maps by Mapy.cz and Satellite imagery by Here Maps ‚úÖ English + 40 other world languages ‚úÖ Now with Wear OS application (Forecast, Radar, Tiles and Complication) ...and many more

Get in touch

üí¨ Join us at community.windy.com to discuss weather related topics or suggest new features. Follow us on social media ‚Ä¢ Facebook: facebook.com/windyforecast ‚Ä¢ Twitter: twitter.com/windycom ‚Ä¢ YouTube: youtube.com ‚Ä¢ Instagram: instagram.com/windy_forecast

summary: Weather radar, satellite, wind, waves, ocean and hurricane forecasts.

scraped_reviews.content: I was a monthly subscriber to the premium version of this amazing app for several years. Then, unforseen circumstances forced me to cancel my subscription a little over a year ago. Now I am happily ready to subscribe again only to discover that the monthly option appears to no longer exist. As this is the only option I am able to afford and I am extremely disappointed. This is precisely how developers lose customers. Not everybody can fork out the price of a years subscription all at once.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback and would like to learn more about your experience. Please contact us at support@windy.com so we can better understand your suggestions and work on improving the app. Thank you, Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: Incredibly powerful app but their attempts to monetize are terrible. I love this app, now I have to find an old APK to revert to a previous version in hopes it fixes it. If you want people to buy premium, don't provide the premium data at all. Don't watermark it and think that going to do something. Don't grayscale it. Just don't let the user access the premium data at all. Be a company of decency in a world of Spotify's, don't make the free version painful to use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your 3-star review and your mention of the issue you have. We're sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused, and we'd love to investigate further. Please send more details to support@windy.com, and we‚Äôll do our best to resolve it. Thank you for helping us improve the app. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: This is by far the best weather app. I've been using it for about five years or so and it was good when I first started using it but with the continuous updates it is the only weather app I would consider using. All the weather information you could ask for, plus air quality maps, drought monitoring, fire risk, tides, and numerous other weather and climate related maps. You can also customize to fit your exact needs Try it to experience how good it really is.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your words about Windy. We really appreciate it and it motivates the whole team to keep working on the app. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: I am completely obsessed with this app!! As a weather junky & living in an area w/quickly changing weather, I've found Windy is shockingly accurate. I'm embarrassed to say, but I currently have 5 weather apps on my phone, and after giving Windy a month, I'm ready to get rid of 3üòÅ. Plus, it's the prettiest app. and on windy days, I take screenshots for the pictures. I'm waiting for the perfect windy day screenshot to blow up and hang on my wall. And I'm being completely serious.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your words about Windy. We really appreciate it and it motivates the whole team to keep working on the app. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: hand down this is undeniably thee best weather app have ever ever come across, has endless layers to its map with a plethora of options for each layer, it would take me weeks on end to fully explore what is available here, even just the free version! EDIT: wanted 2 share my opinion outside of reviews, but couldn't find where- quite disappointed they got rid of the "beta" layer, the layer i exclusively used, nothing has replaced it an satellite layer is not the same, beta had many more options
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We really appreciate your 4-star review and are happy to hear that you're enjoying our app! Your feedback has been noted, and we‚Äôre always working to enhance the experience for our users. If you have any more ideas or specific suggestions, we‚Äôd love to hear them at support@windy.com. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for a little over a month now, and although it has lots of info, the easy of see and use of Weather Channel, AccuWeather and even WeatherBug beats this app. The big problem in my view is that you can see the weather (rain or snow) when it PASSED, but it doesn't show the predicted direction it is going to, which the other apps show. Also, in apps like weather channel you've forecast by hour, this one doesn't. I paid the yearly, but won't renew. uninstalling it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear about your issue and would like to help. Please email details and photos to support@windy.com so we can get further info and potentially resolve this. Your assistance is invaluable in improving Windy.com. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: Hands down the best weather app out there. And $30 for a whole year? what a deal! Occasionally I'll go boating and fishing with my friends and when I do we always use the windy app to check the forecast because it is extremely accurate. It gives you different models to choose from so you can compare. It has at least 50 different layers for things like wind, sea state, sea temperature. everything. And even if you don't pay for the year subscription, the free version is awesome as well!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Your 5-star review is a huge compliment to us. Thank you for your trust and support! Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: My favorite weather app. The customization options are great. I can make the data appear in the order that is most useful for me. And I can choose the data provider I want. Fantastic. I would like it if the provider options could have their positions in the list changed to an order that works best for me and the providers I would be likely to use. Other than that, great app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Your 5-star review is truly appreciated. Thanks for helping us spread the word about Windy.com! Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: Excellent weather app with one problem- I can't get the widget to work after last pixel update The app has every type of weather data you could possibly ask for and a beautiful map with a ton of overlays, multiple sites, etc. When the widget is fixed I'll give it a 5 star without hesitation Oh yeah, works well on my pixel 2 watch.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We really appreciate your 4-star review and are happy to hear that you're enjoying our app! Your feedback has been noted, and we‚Äôre always working to enhance the experience for our users. If you have any more ideas or specific suggestions, we‚Äôd love to hear them at support@windy.com. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: One of my favorite weather apps! However, it would be great to see improvement in the maps formatting, zoom & map scroll feature on android. For example, When I check radiation areas in certain areas and try to zoom out (by " pinching") on the map for a broader view, the map will only zoom out so far & when you lift your fingers off the map, it retracts back to where it was previously- that's not quite so UI friendly...but overall excellent app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the sunny forecast in your review! üå§Ô∏è We're thrilled you're enjoying the weather with Windy.com. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: As a farmer, a weather app is much needed. For years I was using the Storm app. It gave me alerts when rain was about to start, nearby lightning strikes, and weather alerts. The radar was always on point too. The colors were defined. If there was any color overhead, 99% of the time there was some sort of precipitation occurring. Windy doesn't send notifications, and I can't trust the radar colors. Half the time a system will look bigger on Windy than another app. If changes were made, I'd use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Kendall, you can also create notification via Windy. Here is how to do it: Select a point on the map, then click on the heart symbol in the top right corner and select "Create alert". In the alert, you can select which parameter you are interested in such as rain. In the settings you can choose mobile or email notifications. Regards, Korina

scraped_reviews.content: Although it defaults to wind, you can track the weather-- the precipitation, the snow accumulation, etc - and you can get a ten day forecast that shows temperature fluctuations across the bottom of the screen. There are so many selections to choose from, including different forecast models. I consider the premium app to be worth it, and much more useful/detailed than other weather apps!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Your 5-star review is a huge compliment to us. Thank you for your trust and support! Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: WOW....so much information in this app. Wind direction and speed, radar, precipitation, cloud cover, temperatures, forecasts.... and so much more! After using this app for three years, it only gets better. With the widgets, one can see the weather details on a map. I really like using Windy along with MeteoBlue to get a very good forecast and see current conditions for the local area. Again... Great work everyone!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your 5-star review. We're glad you're enjoying our service, and we promise to keep it up! Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: I really wanted to use this app, and came really close to purchasing the premium subscription. The large weather maps and animated wind patterns, plus all the other interesting layers that are available are nothing short of amazing. But the tiny fonts and tiny controls are just too hard to use. I mean I can manage, but it's uncomfortable, Even worse, there is no option to adjust this. The developers are essentially leaving out everyone without perfect eyesight.

Wow. Simple layout with a LOT of detail at your fingertips should you choose to access it (see the sandwich menu). Select the layers you want -- or the weather model, even. I like that it gives projected rainfall AMOUNTS, rather than percentage of likelihood. Much more useful. Quite reliable, too. For all it's features, if it were unreliable, I would find another app. But it's become my go-to.

The most user-friendly weather map system in existence. I use this app all the time, but especially love it for the ability to see weather patterns throughout a range of regions. The map allows me to see which areas around me have the best potential for the wind. However, it is not at all limited to wind readings. All other weather features are useful for anyone. My only complaint is that the forecasted wind gusts tend to be missleadingly high. Otherwise the accuracy is good.

One of the best weather forecast apps. Many layers you can keep watch on, and several models you can use. Offers the ECMWF for free, which is extremely rare. But there are more features behind a premium subscription so... Also, if you go on the desktop version, you can create custom colors for layers which will transfer to your phone, if you are logged into the same account. Really cool! I recommend this app.

This app is perfect in so many ways. When I first started using it, I was a couple miles offshore in a sailboat and needed to know what the wind was going to be doing. Easy peasy - it shows that right away and it's probably the best app on the market for that. A couple weeks later I'm concerned with the wave height - lo and behold, Windy does that too. Is there fog nearby? The forecast map doesn't show much, but they have video feeds at certain locations and I can tap into those. The list goes on and on. It's the best broad-view weather app, in my opinion.

Don't get me wrong I love windy more than any other service. However I'm giving 3/5 stars because the Android widgets need work, there is no reason a widget needs unrestricted battery access, constant GPS access, and always on notifications. Especially considering other competitive app widgets can operate just fine without those. At the very least make those settings optional, not all users need that level of precision.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your review. Thank you for your feedback. We would love to hear more about your experience so we can make the app better for you. Please reach out to us at support@windy.com with any suggestions or details. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: Great visualization but you missed a target demographic of users...Truck drivers. If you could add a US highway system and better city center locations overlay that would be really helpful. Otherwise it's a fantastic app. EDIT: I'll give you that 5th star when you add visible highways to the map. It's not that difficult... they're already there and they don't move.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Timothy, thank you for suggestion, we will think about it. ~ Best, Windy

scraped_reviews.content: Love the advanced weather model data! Especially the winds at multiple Altitudes. I can even see the Jetstream above 400 mb level. It goes All the way up to the 250 mb level, almost 40,000 feet. Also, I can see model data from the EURO, & GFS models in one easy to use app. Plus the fire data is unparalleled. Nice radar, precipitation, clouds, & air quality. It's almost my main weather app. I just would like graphical hourly data for local regions. The local data in Windy, is not as detailed.

I was really happy with this app when I first got it. I feel like now that they're pushing the subscription model, it's lacking. For example - it can pull weather from 4-5 different sources, some more accurate than others. However, it never remembers the choice and defaults to the same one. Just today there is a 5 degree difference in the forecasted high between this and accuweather. I tried to choose the option that was closer, but nothing changed.-- note to dev- I paid for the old Windy app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Windy Premium is here for users who want to support us and in exchange get a 1-hour forecast, updates 4 times a day instead of 2, and more extra features in the future. The free version still remains ads-free and with all its functions :) It is not possible to choose the default model. ~ Best, Windy

scraped_reviews.content: this is one of the greatest weather apps you can get if you're a weather nerd. literally everything you could possibly want, no extraneous ads that make it hard to see, and it's extremely intuitive. the only minor change I might make is swapping the label from "Rain" to "precipitation", because it threw me off when I wanted to see the model predicted snowfall.

Best weather app there is. May look complex at first sight, but so does anything that covers as much information accurately. I do mean accurately. I drive a high profile vehicle and it is important for me to know when and where to get off the road. This app has saved my hide numerous times. Compared to other wind and weather apps Windy is at the forefront of what they should be. Informative, accurate, and reliable.

Cool enough app, but you can't just log in on a new device and expect your Premium status to be recognized. You have to dig through your emails for a FastSpring order confirmation code and enter it manually into the app. And it never works without having to contact support. I don't believe I should have to go out of my way to prove I'm a paying customer after logging in. That's the singular purpose of logging in. I've canceled my renewal and will be trying other alternatives. Really too bad.

If you don't want a widget, Windy is the best weather app. Unfortunately, Widgets no longer work on Android w Pixel phones. You try to add a widget, and the widget settings buttons do nothing. On the off chance it puts a widget on your home screen, that widget will never load data from the app. Have changed battery optimization, notification, and myriad other settings to no avail. It's really irritating, because otherwise the app is excellent and the weather is incredibly accurate.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback and would like to learn more about your experience. Please contact us at support@windy.com so we can better understand your suggestions and work on improving the app. Thank you, Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: Pro version features do not work well. I've been using this for the last 2 months every day solo sailing the Bahamas and the wind is always at least 3kts more than it shows even in real time. most annoying, is half the time I cannot just go to my location and have to find it on the map. Planning a route doesn't work for me because I can't click on where I set the time
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback and would like to learn more about your experience. Please contact us at support@windy.com so we can better understand your suggestions and work on improving the app. Thank you, Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: I almost never buy app subscriptions but I subscribe to Windy. The free version is great, the paid version adds some features that are definitely worth it. Having access to so many different weather models so easily and so well-integrated is awesome. I do not believe I have seen an app with such excellent integration of weather radar and lightning mapping as well.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Your 5-star review is a huge compliment to us. Thank you for your trust and support! Ondra, Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: I'm a fan of the app since wind speed is often badly wrong in other weather apps. My only complaint is that the temperature doesn't change to Fahrenheit, which I attempted to set in the initial setting prompt, on the settings page, and by carefully clicking on the temperature in the city forecast display. I'd make this my go-to weather app and subscribe, but this very basic flaw puts me off. Updated to reflect the fact that Fahrenheit/Celsius control now works.

Pretty good. Not as accurate as Weather Underground used to be but its my new weather app. The need for better accuracy keeps me from giving a 5 star rating however, its great if youre an aviator or outdoorsman. Korina, it was when I first started using the app but after about a week or so I noticed it got to be a lot better. Edit: As of today, May 3 2023, if location is not enabled I cannot view the weather radar. Uninstalling.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Coray, we visualize forecast based on the global weather model, we do not create our own. If you are not getting accurate results, you may want to try other models such as ECMWF, GFS, Arome etc. Thank you. Korina

scraped_reviews.content: They switched a feature that is ALWAYS available through every other weather app (for free) to premium only. You shouldn't have to pay to see a 10 day forecast. Everything else sure. But only 5 days available to us? Useless app now for free users. I don't want to support a company that forces people who can not afford 30 dollars a year for an app to pay to use a basic feature.

I really wish I had had this plethora of information this app provides when I was forecasting for a living in the Navy oh so many years ago. And it's all free!! The radar isn't as fine granular as in some other apps, but it is world wide!! I didn't eve know China had weather radar!! And when I was forecasting I didn't have the access to all the different models that this app provides. This app is actually slightly better than the web-based app, which has a few frustrating glitches. Using this app, I was able to determine accurately that weren't going to get snow or freezing rain this morning but rather a short period of ice pellets. I couldn't have pulled it off with the tools that I had available to me 30 years ago.

Best weather app by far! Like the old intellicast app (lots of data & detail), but 10x better! Perfect for outdoor enthusiasts (boating, sailing, kite boarding, wind surfing, pilots and the like)... prob too much detail for noobs who only want too know if it's sunny outside. All other weather apps out there dumb down their info to the point where it's useless. Windy actually provides the level of data needed to make real decisions. The app is 100% free, but I donated to help keep them running

Apparently the new widget UI design is to make them useless. I've cleared cache, user data, uninstalled, re-installed, rebooted and all I ever get are big black boxes for the widgets. It's the same thing on 3 different devices. Downloaded v39.1.1 and they work fine. 39.1.4 doesn't work. Update: So they still haven't fixed the app and now I get an in-app message saying they are going to force users to update to the broken version. What a great way to lose users completely.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app, lots of information. What I dislike is the lack of ability to see all the information I need on a route (boating). I see wave height, but I also want to the frequency, I want to see the wind waves. All the info is there, but I have to close the route each time to change to another view. The app needs the ability to customize what I want to see and select multiple layers, like wind, wave, wind waves, and frequency. This is key to mariners!

scraped_reviews.content: Glad I tried to set up the widget prior to paying for the full version, because it is broken and won't work at all on my phone (Pixel 7). Other pixel users w same issue.

scraped_reviews.content: Mobile app working fine thus morning but now, missing access to the weather parameters at the right of the maps. Used to have a cloud/lightning icon which allowed me to chose weather radar or satellite clouds. Then a hamburger icon which would pop up a list of all the other parameters. Can't find them and can't find my to anything other than the winds. Desktop app is fine though I'm afraid to shut it down for fear of losing the ability to access all the other layers.

200 settings are too detailed for me. And then when I reopen the app, the settings are lost and I have to start again. Therefore, I'm required to make a dozen adjustments to get a simple weather map, such as having to figure out how to get rid of the wind vectors every time, add the temperature, increase the font so I can read the temperatures, etc. Just too much work. Windyty SE replied: > If you have an account you can set some layers... I'll create an account because Windy came recommended.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thank you for your review! ~ Best, Windy

scraped_reviews.content: Lots of good data that I'd normally have to go to multiple websites to view,which is nice. What isn't nice is the lack of forecasting and hourly breakdowns unless you pay. A typical phone home screen will give you an hourly forecast for free so I don't see why someone would pay for it. Otherwise,the app is impressively quick to load considering how detailed the map is even though it takes a bit of fiddling to learn what all the buttons do and which data you want to see.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Ruffian, thank you for your feedback, we will take it into account. ~ Best, Windy

scraped_reviews.content: This app is good & also a useful tool for tracking different storms in different parts of the world, but there's one thing that makes it not 5 stars. This is the color representing the wind speed. The color scale needs to be more broad. For example. The purple. I see what looks like a storm & is purple, but is it the low purple wind speeds? OR The storm level high purple wind speeds? One of the purple colors in the scale needs to be replaced. You can't have 1 color represent 2 different things!

Despite allowing all permissions, widget says it cannot load my location so it's pointless to even have a widget. When app is opened, it very rarely opens to the correct location. Other weather apps have no problem with my location. Once it is opened, deciphering the correct date is confusing as the day/date only briefly shows. Cant see paying for an app that can't do the basics.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear about your issue and would like to help. Please email details and photos to support@windy.com so we can get further info and potentially resolve this. Your assistance is invaluable in improving Windy.com. Ondra from Windy.com

scraped_reviews.content: Windy was my go-to weather app for paramotor / glider sports until the most recent UI update. Maybe I'm dense, but I can't get it to do what I want. For no reason, I get daily weather notifications for a random spot in the Arctic Ocean, even though I've never favorited anything in that area (by several thousand miles). The app always opens to a much more zoomed out extent than makes sense (seeing, for instance, several U.S. states). It's been a few weeks, and I have to say the new UI is a bust.

So a few things about the update, first, widgets will not stay loaded. Second, when I changed location, right now the app still thinks that I am 120 miles to the south. Third, you close the app after refreshing the location, then when you close it, it goes BACK to the cached location. And from a usability standpoint, having text versus pictures for the data layers is way easier. I unfortunately was forced to update (I had rolled back the update in hopes that this would change). Please fix!!!

Great app with plenty of data. I've been using for over a year. Only reason it's not 5 stars is there are bugs far too frequently. For a while the lightning wasn't working, it happened again somewhat recently but overall good now. Widgets have been constantly buggy though. For one it keeps converting to either light or dark mode and I need to switch back to system default. Also keeps needing to be reloaded and often goes blank or data loading. Now they only load in Celsius. Need a fix for 5 star
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear about your issue and would like to help. Please email details and photos to support@windy.com so we can get further info and potentially resolve this. Your assistance is invaluable in improving Windy.com. Ondra from Windy

scraped_reviews.content: Great app, widgets need work! Most of my interaction with this app is with the widget, I have a pixel 3 and there is just too much info in the 4x1 widget, instead of 8 temp, sunshine, wind numbers for each day maybe consider less so that the numbers don't have to be so small, I do love all the info but it's a pain to read, even when I stretch the widget larger nothing changes. Perhaps I'm missing an option somewhere? Also I'd like a rain % rating somehow, maybe the cloud icons are based on %?

I originally down loaded "windy.app" by mistake. This app is exactly what I need and only 40MB. I'm an avid two string stunt Kite flying person. I need to know when the wind will have a high average with low gusts for consistency in my Line tension and tail length. The other app was ok but made more for fishermen and hunters with weather cycles, migration patterns and fish nesting spots. The other app was a gig of storage and subscription plans up to 200$. I'm glad I have the right app now
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your words about Windy. We really appreciate it and it motivates the whole team to keep working on the app. Ondra from Windy

scraped_reviews.content: I love the concept, and the app provides much more data than most. I use it daily, but there is a problem. The map only updates with a drastic change in time. If you want to move forward one or two hours, you have to first move five or six hours away, then back to the time you want. This is particlarly bad in the temperature view.
